author: Staff Reporter
text:
Farmers affiliated to Tamilaga Vivasayeegal Sangam (the faction that is not affiliated to any political party) on Saturday staged a protest asking the State Government to take steps to prevent the entry of wild animals into agriculture fields.

A press release says that led by State president M.R. Sivasamy, the farmers complained that boar, deer, peafowl apart from elephants entered fields to destroy crops. The Government should compensate those farmers who had lost their crops to the animals and gale.

In the past three months there had been several instances of elephants entering not only farms but also human habitations but the Government had done little to prevent their entry, the farmers charged and add that the only way they could solve the problem was to invade cities from villages as the animals entered farms, the press release added.

For, their action would draw the attention of the authorities concerned and force them to provide solution, the farmers said.
title: Farmers stage protest
